properties.address: The Swan & Helmet, Northampton, Northamptonshire NN1 3LJ
properties.description: Cheers for Tuesdays was established in partnership with Northamptonshire Social Subscribers, who identified the need for a social club for men in the area. Every Tuesday, from 2-4pm at The Swan and Helmet Pub, our men’s club comes together to enjoy all sorts of fun activities and connect with friends. Whether it’s playing fun games like darts, pool, cards or indoor golf, or just sitting with a hot drink and chatting to one of our friendly volunteers or members of the club – there’s something for everyone! Our men’s club is constantly growing, and we love to welcome new faces each session. Cheers for Tuesdays offers a really supportive, uplifting space that has been an immense benefit to all our members.
properties.title: Cheers for Tuesdays (The McCarthy-Dixon Foundation)

properties.address: Northamptonshire County Council, Northampton, Northamptonshire NN1 2BA
properties.description: Northamptonshire Central Library is the flagship library of West Northamptonshire and offers a wide range of services and facilities, including: Business & IP Centre: Provides resources and workshops for entrepreneurs, inventors, and small businesses. Discover Centre: A dedicated area for local and family history research. Computers, Internet, Wi-Fi, and Printing: Available for public use. Events and Activities: Regular events for all age groups, including activities for under 5s. Accessibility: The library is wheelchair accessible and offers a quieter hour on Tuesdays from 9am to 10am. The library is open from Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm, and on Saturday from 9am to 5pm. We also has facilities like baby changing areas and toilets for parents with young children.
properties.title: Northamptonshire Central Library

properties.address: Semilong Community Centre, Northampton, Northamptonshire NN2 6HS
properties.description: This space is open to everyone, we offer a free hot snack, newspapers to read, a craft corner where you can bring your own or join in with something we're doing. We also offer advice and support around cost of living and a friendly ear!!
properties.title: Semilong Community Drop-In

properties.address: Fox & Hounds Public House, Stony, Stratford MK111AT
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 20th November 2023** We have 2 rooms, a lounge and snug with board games and a TV in both rooms showing day time programming for people to watch whilst they eat and drink. Teas and Coffees are free of charge and bottomless. We also have a menu with all the classics that we know you will all love and will be doing fresh scones with jam and clotted cream and/or butter. Great place to spend the afternoon.
properties.title: Shawn Martin Peacock

properties.address: The Swan & Helmet, Northampton, Northamptonshire NN1 3LJ
properties.description: Stay Well Wednesdays runs every Wednesday from 10:30am-1:00pm, and offers a huge range of fantastic activities and services. For £5 entry, we provide a hot lunch and unlimited hot drinks. We run a keep-fit class each week, which is open for anyone to get involved in. The sessions are super beginner friendly and accessible to everyone, with seated versions available for every exercise! After the keep-fit sessions, we run all sorts of fun wellbeing games, talks and activities – we switch it up every week to keep things exciting! Members are always encouraged to take these activities at their own pace, and our lovely team of volunteers and staff will always do their utmost to make everyone comfortable.
properties.title: Stay Well Wednesdays (The McCarthy-Dixon Foundation)

properties.address: The Swan & Helmet, Northampton, Northamptonshire NN1 3LJ
properties.description: The Monday Club is run every Monday from 12-4pm from The Swan and Helmet Pub, in Northampton. It offers a safe and welcoming space, for individuals from all backgrounds and all ages to connect, make friends and enjoy themselves. For £5 entry, Monday Club members access unlimited hot drinks, a lunch, live entertainment and music, and a bingo and raffle. We often have brilliant live music from various local artists, including The Wild Rover, and Tony Kelly The Galway Boy. Lots of our members love to get up for a dance, and others just enjoy sitting with friends for a good catch-up.
properties.title: The Monday Club (The McCarthy-Dixon Foundation)

properties.address: Camp Close, Bugbrooke, Northamptonshire, NN7 3RW
properties.description: The Community Living Room is hosted at 3 venues in the village - Bugbrooke Church, Bugbrooke Chapel and Jubilee House supported living scheme, each opens weekly throughout the year with the exception of a short break over the Christmas holidays. Every venue offers free light refreshments and is open to anyone living in the parish. In addition, at the Chapel we host regular visits from external agencies offering support and advice to local people. These include WNC Customer Services and Highways teams, South Northants Volunteer Bureau Community Connect advisers, local PCSO, and Parish Councillors. The service is open every week at the following times and venues: Bugbrooke Church - Monday morning 10.00 - 11.30 Jubilee House - Tuesday afternoon 1.30 - 5.00 (not during August) Bugbrooke Chapel - Thursday afternoon 2.00 - 5.00
properties.title: Bugbrooke Community Living Room

properties.address: Parish Office, Camp Close, Bugbrooke, Northamptonshire, NN7 3RW

properties.address: The Sixfields Stadium, Northampton, Northamptonshire, NN5 5QA
properties.description: Premier League Kicks inspires children and young people to achieve their potential and improve their wellbeing; working together to build stronger, safer and more inclusive communities. When arrived will be meet by volunteers who will help them to the have a cup of tea, coffee and introduce the new people to our existing members. We have a programme of activates, usually start with an activation session in chairs or using equipment to get people moving. After the activation we will have a games using boccia, curling, skittles. Bing and stand up bingo is another activation activity which is popular. Once a month we have a guest speaker, singer, fitness activator to the group. we have people in our group are excellent at card making, weeks before Christmas, Easter there will be card making on Christmas cards and at Easter, Easter cards. If people don't mind sharing their skills we will use them, if they don't now problem . we have personnel from the Trust and Northampton Town given talks about their roles at Northampton Town.
properties.title: Northampton Town FC Community Trust

properties.address: Mount Pleasant Baptist Church 147 - 153, Kettering Road, Northampton, Northamptonshire, NN1 4BS
properties.description: Our Renew 147 wellbeing cafe is a simple cafe style community space in our church worship area, where hobbies and activities are shared or co-produced, ie people can bring their own hobbies with them. Or our visitors can just sit, relax and chat. It is held every Thursday from 1pm to 3.30 pm., coffees and biscuits are available for everyone and it is a place where people feel safe, loved and listened to. Other activities include colouring, painting and drawing, card games and board games.  There is also an optional quiet place set up for anyone who would like to sit and reflect with us prayerfully. This happens twice during the afternoon. All are welcome. The activities are based around the '5 ways to wellbeing' which promote good mental and emotional health: * To connect,  * give,  * be active,  * keep learning * take notice All of which we hope will contribute towards our wellbeing.
properties.title: Renew 147 Wellbeing Cafe

properties.address: 16 Hester Street, Northampton , Northamptonshire , NN2 6AP
properties.description: Semilong Community Exchange (SCE) is a grassroots, volunteer-led organisation offering free hot meals, essentials, and a welcoming social space for anyone in need across Northampton. We prioritise dignity, inclusivity, and lived experience—there are no eligibility checks or barriers to access, and everyone is welcome. Our hubs provide holistic support, advice, and signposting on a range of issues, from housing and benefits to wellbeing and community connection. All services are funded by donations and run by local volunteers, ensuring transparency and community ownership. SCE’s mission is to reduce hardship, tackle loneliness, and empower individuals to thrive, one meal and one conversation at a time.
properties.title: Semilong Community Exchange

An opportunity to meet other local people and make new friends A hot meal free of charge Laptop/Computers, Wi-Fi & printer available to use. Drinks & Snacks. Toys for little ones to play with   A quiet area with adult colouring and newspapers Donated clothes, books, and household items to take away for free. A donation point to drop off your unwanted items
